summary: This bill, the "No Pay for Congress During Default or Shutdown Act," aims to reduce the pay of Members of Congress if the public debt limit is reached or a government shutdown occurs.  It mandates a reduction in annual pay based on the duration of either event. For the 119th Congress, the bill proposes holding the withheld salaries in escrow and releasing them at the end of the term. The Secretary of the Treasury is tasked with assisting payroll administrators in implementing the act.
